abstract: Two banks are changing their debit card programs to end some charges that have enraged consumers.
snippet: Two banks are changing their debit card programs to end some charges that have enraged consumers.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase, two of the nation’s biggest banks, announced plans on Tuesday to drastically overhaul their debit card programs by lowering or eliminating fees, changing the way they credit transactions and allowing customers to opt out of overdraft protection.

headline.main: Chase and Bank of America Revise Fee Policies
headline.print_headline: Chase and Bank of America Revise Overdraft Fee Policies

abstract: Michael Moore, the film maker who tried to make “citizen’s arrests” of nation’s banking chiefs in “Capitalism: A Love Story,” talked with DealBook about his new film and his views on Wall Street.
snippet: Michael Moore, the film maker who tried to make “citizen’s arrests” of nation’s banking chiefs in “Capitalism: A Love Story,” talked with DealBook about his new film and his views on Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: Not many people can lay claim to attempting a “citizen’s arrest” of the nation’s banking bosses. But it’s par for the course for Michael Moore, the controversial film maker whose latest documentary on the financial crisis takes a harsh look at capitalism — and Wall Street banks like Goldman Sachs, Citigroup, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase.

abstract: Despite a turbulent year for the nation’s banks, Heidi Miller of JPMorgan Chase has retained her position at the top of U.S. Banker’s and American Banker’s annual list of the 25 most powerful women in banking.
snippet: Despite a turbulent year for the nation’s banks, Heidi Miller of JPMorgan Chase has retained her position at the top of U.S. Banker’s and American Banker’s annual list of the 25 most powerful women in banking.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street may have been utterly rearranged by the financial crisis, but at least one thing has remained constant: Heidi Miller of JPMorgan Chase has kept her position at the top of U.S. Banker’s and American Banker’s list of the 25 most powerful women in banking.

headline.main: A Powerful Woman Banker Retains Her Ranking
